text: there's an idea that I've had about love
for actually quite a long time now that
I've been trying to wrestle with in a
number of books I mean I think ever
since the ground beneath our feet really
yeah which is that love might not be as
romantic as we think it is you know that
it might be rather rather more savage
than that you know that there are there
are all these other ideas that we attach
to love and such as fidelity and
longevity and and so on that might
actually have nothing to do with it at
all you know they might just be ways of
domesticating it you know but that
actually it might be a more barbarian
thing than that you know and and I've
just tried to explore that the way in
which love is not what one expects it to
be you know it's more dangerous I'd say
I think yeah I know that well in
Charlotte aren't you I mean there's a
moment at which this girl loves her
husband but leaves him for a more
powerful man you know and just makes
that choice ruthlessly so there's a and
I'm just not sure I don't buy the idea
of violins and you know all that I don't
think it's like that always can be lucky
you if it is
